@mmattel would you normally not just rename the drive in the owncloud interface for externally mounted drives?

@mtgap can you check it out?

mount.php has been in the meanwhile substituted by mount.json
just as a side note: mount php was <much> better human readable and adoptable than mount.json, but anyway....
the point, either we manually change a mount.json file or we restore one, the behaviour that the new mount file does not get properly recognized by oc after apache restart is close the same. you only can do a change via the app external local drive. for me, and i may have the wrong view, the app is only a interface for a setup file to be created and then used by oc. in a nutshell, create it and call oc to reread it.
i want to highlight, that when you setup a new instance, all mounts have to be created again via the app. a restore of mount.json is not possible...

@jancborchardt important is the issue when renaming the shared local folder in the web ui:
using oc 5.0 official download, host is win8, with xampp.

@luckydonald i canâ€™t really help, but thanks for the detailed reproduction steps! i hope @mtgap or @schiesbn can take a look at it.

i guess i was thinking of permissions inside the external storage and not outside. so, we remove the update and delete permissions to the root of the external storage as @luckydonald has suggested. and i believe we need to change the storage id if there is a change in the folder name in the external storage configuration ui so we don't have a full rescan and old data sitting around. can you confirm @icewind1991?

> and i believe we need to change the storage id if there is a change in the folder name in the external storage configuration ui so we don't have a full rescan and old data sitting around.

the data in the folder stays the same, it's only the name of the folder inside oc's filesystem that changes.
okay, yes you're right. i was thinking that the id used the folder name.

iâ€™m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if you still encounter this issue with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch â€“ see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
